intro: Warneckea masoalae, commonly known as the Madagascar warneckea, is a species of flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its evergreen leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. It typically grows in humid, shaded environments within the rainforests of Madagascar. Due to its limited distribution and habitat threats, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
